required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Gather Information on the Acceptability of a New Flavor System With Increasing Levels of 2, 4, 6 g or Higher of Mannitol for PEG 3350 in Subjects Having Infrequent Bowel Movements.
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Center, Open-label, Parallel Arm, Phase 4 Study to Evaluate the Acceptability of a Prototype Flavor System With Ascending Levels of 2,4,6 Grams or Higher of Mannitol for PEG 3350 Laxative in Subjects Suffering With Occasional Constipation.

brief_summary.textblock: Study to gather information on the acceptability of a new flavor system with increasing levels of 2, 4, 6 g or higher of the sugar alcohol Mannitol for Polyethylene glycol (PEG) 3350 a drug stimulating bowel movement to pass stool in subjects having infrequent bowel movements. The taste of the various preparations will be measured by use of a rating scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Opinion of the Products' Flavor
primary_outcome.description: Evaluated by 7-point scales: 1-extremely dislike, 2-moderately dislike, 3-dislike somewhat, 4-neither like nor dislike, 5-like somewhat, 6-moderately like, 7-extremely like

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Opinion of the Amount of Flavor in the Products
primary_outcome.description: Evaluated by 7-point scales: -3 -extremely weak, -2 -somewhat weak, -1 -slightly weak, 0 -just the right level of flavor, 1 -slightly intense, 2 -moderately intense, 3 -much too intense

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Opinion of the Products' Sweetness
primary_outcome.description: Evaluated by 7-point scales: -3 -no sweetness needed, -2 -needs to be moderately sweeter, -1 -needs to be a little sweeter, 0 -just the right level of sweetness, 1 -slightly too sweet, 2 -moderately sweet, 3 -much too sweet

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With/Without Cooling Sensation in the Products.
primary_outcome.description: Whether or not subjects felt a cooling sensation (yes/no).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Different Levels of Cooling Sensation of the Products
primary_outcome.description: Evaluated by 4-point scales: 1 -barely perceptible, 2 -slightly noticeable, 3 -moderately noticeable, 4 -extremely noticeable

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Opinion of Aftertaste in the Products.
primary_outcome.description: Whether or not subjects experienced aftertaste (yes/no).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Different Levels of Aftertaste of the Products
primary_outcome.description: Evaluated by 3-point scales: 1 -slightly noticeable, 2 -moderately noticeable, 3 -extremely noticeable

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With no Bowel Movement
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects who did not report any bowel movement was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Bowel Movement (In Hours)
secondary_outcome.description: The mean and standard deviation of the time to first bowel movement in hours were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants for Gas Rating
secondary_outcome.description: A gas rating score of 0 means that there was no gas experienced, while a score of 1 represents slight gas experienced, 2 represents moderate gas experienced and 3 represents severe gas experienced.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants for Bloating Rating
secondary_outcome.description: A score of zero represents no bloating, while a score of 1 represents slight bloating, 2 represents moderate bloating and 3 represents severe bloating.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants for Abdominal Discomfort Rating
secondary_outcome.description: A score of 0 represents no abdominal pain, 1 represents slight abdominal pain, 2 represents moderate abdominal pain and 3 represents severe abdominal pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With no Successful Bowel Movement
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects who did not report the successful bowel movement was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Successful Bowel Movement (In Hours)
secondary_outcome.description: The mean and standard deviation of the time to first successful bowel movement in hours were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.description: Including serious adverse events and adverse events.

arm_group.description: MiraLAX Sachet (17g) + Flavor blend (2g mannitol total)
MiraLAX Sachet (17g) + Flavor blend + additional 2g mannitol (4g mannitol total)
MiraLAX Sachet (17g) + Flavor blend + additional 4g mannitol (6g mannitol total)
MiraLAX Sachet (17g) + Flavor blend + additional 6g mannitol (8g mannitol total)
MiraLAX Sachet (17g) + Flavor blend + additional 8g mannitol (10g mannitol total)

intervention.description: Oral solution, 17g polyethylene glycol, one time

criteria.textblock: Male and female subjects, aged 18 years and older, suffering with occasional constipation

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study was conducted in US from 13Feb2013 (first patient first visit) to 19Mar2013 (last patient last visit).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Sixty-two (62) subjects was screened and fifty (50) subjected completed the study.

group.description: MiraLAX Sachet (17g) + Flavor blend (2g mannitol total)

group.title: All Population
group.description: MiraLAX Sachet (17g) + Flavor blend (2g, 4g, 6g, 8g and 10g mannitol total). Baseline data were not collected separately for Arms/Groups.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
